body_html:
+1 for having denaified versions of the CTC loss and decoders. You'll need to pass an additional Sequence lengths for the labels. PRs to tf.contrib.layers welcome.
…
On Tue, Jan 9, 2018, 6:34 PM Jerome ***@***.***> wrote: One reason I would like this feature to exist is to be able to use Tensorflow’s Estimator.fit without having to covert the labels to a SparseTensor outside the fit function. — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. body:
+1 for having denaified versions of the CTC loss and decoders. You'll need
to pass an additional Sequence lengths for the labels.  PRs to
tf.contrib.layers welcome.

On Tue, Jan 9, 2018, 6:34 PM Jerome <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> One reason I would like this feature to exist is to be able to use
> Tensorflow’s Estimator.fit without having to covert the labels to a
> SparseTensor outside the fit function.
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
